text: The Government has provided its response to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide’s Final Report. The majority of the Royal Commission’s recommendations were accepted: https://dva.gov.au/documents-and-publications/royal-commission-publications…

The day has arrived! Join us tonight for the PM’s National Veteran Employment Awards. Let’s celebrate the significant contributions of organisations and individual veterans and their partners in our civilian workforce. Live updates here: https://linkedin.com/company/veteransemploymentau/…

Just under one week until the PM’s Veteran Employment Awards! Join us in celebrating the invaluable contributions of organisations and individual veterans and their partners in our civilian workforce. Updates at: https://linkedin.com/company/veteransemploymentau/…
#PMVeteranAwards #VeteranEmployment

Expressions of interest for the 2025 Women Veterans Policy Forum are now open! We want to hear from women who have served in the ADF. Your voice matters. Express your interest here: https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_4H0ruaSx0djo9oO…
We recently spoke with Bruce, who sought help from an ESO advocate following his partner’s passing in 2021. You can find his story on the DVA website – http://dva.gov.au/latest-news

69 grants will be awarded to ex-service and community organisations, and they will receive a share of over $3.7 million in grant funding through our Veteran Wellbeing Grants program. Read more: http://dva.gov.au/VWG

The veteran community came together to put on some fantastic events for #VeteransHealthWeek 2024 in support of the theme Keep Connected. Thank you to all those in the veteran community who hosted an event, and to those who participated. Tell us about your experience (1/3)

Feedback survey for event holders (organisations): http://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3VQVx3gah8SIImy…

(3/3)

We’d love you to tell us about your 2024 Veterans’ Health Week experience by completing a survey – for participants: http://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8pHHnLGri7fy5Cu…

(2/3)

This week we commemorated the 25th anniversary of Australian service in Timor-Leste with a seminar and National Commemorative Service. Lest we forget. Click here to view photos from today’s national commemorative service: https://flic.kr/s/aHBqjBJgeE

From tomorrow, some DVA pension and compensation payments for veterans and families will receive an indexation increase. The increase will appear in payments automatically, with the first full payment happening 17 October. More info: http://dva.gov.au/financial-support…

From 20 September 2024, there will be a 10% increase to the maximum rate of rent assistance to help with cost-of-living pressures. Learn more at: http://dva.gov.au/financial-support/payment-rates/summary-pension-rates-limits-and-allowances…

Today is National Peacekeepers’ Day. 

We acknowledge all Australians who have served on peacekeeping operations since 1947. 

Lest we forget. 

#ADFVeterans #AusNavy #AusArmy #AusAirForce #AFP #PeacekeepersDay #TimorLeste25
The Government has tabled the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide’s Final Report in the Australian Parliament. Please contact @OpenArmsSupport on 1800 011 046 if you need support.
On 19 September 2024, the Minister for Veterans’ Affairs @mattkeogh will host a Veteran Forum in Brisbane. Register here: https://dva.gov.au/about/engagement/veteran-forums…
Today, we commemorate Malaya and Borneo Veterans’ Day. We acknowledge all who served during the Malayan Emergency (1948-1960) and Indonesian Confrontation (1962-1966). Lest we forget.
Next month, the Minister for Veterans’ Affairs @MattKeogh will host two Veteran Forums in Perth. Register here: https://dva.gov.au/about/engagement/veteran-forums…

The Ex-Service Organisation Roundtable (ESORT) Working Group has proposed the creation of an Institute of Veterans’ Advocates  to strenghten advocacy support for veterans and families. For more info and to have your say visit:  https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/institute-veterans-advocates-consultation…
Next week the Minister for Veterans’ Affairs, @mattkeogh, will host a series of Veteran Forums in Adelaide, Sydney and Melbourne. Register here: https://dva.gov.au/about/engagement/veteran-forums…
Today we acknowledge Vietnam Veterans’ Day. Coinciding with the anniversary of the Battle of Long Tan, today we commemorate the service of all who served in the Vietnam War. Lest we forget.

On Friday 20 September 2024, we commemorate the 25th anniversary of Australian service in Timor-Leste. A national commemorative service will be held at the Australian Peacekeeping Memorial on Anzac Parade in Canberra. Register here: https://dva.gov.au/recognition/commemorations/commemorative-services/commemorative-services-australia/25th-anniversary-australian-service-timor-leste…

26 July is the last chance to apply for Vietnam War commemorative medallion honouring the service and sacrifice of Australians who served in the Vietnam War. Vietnam veterans, their widow or other family members can apply at:https://dva.gov.au/recognition/commemorations/commemorative-services/commemorative-services-australia/50th-anniversary-end-australias-involvement-vietnam-war/vietnam-war-commemorative-medallion-and-certificate…
#Vietnam50

$4.7 million in grant funding has been awarded to 102 ex-service organisations (ESOs) through the Building Excellence in Support and Training grants program. These grants support ESOs to deliver advocacy services to veterans in their local community. More: http://grants.gov.au

The DVA Client Insights Survey closing date has been extended until 11:59pm (AEST) Sunday, 21 July. This will allow even more DVA clients to complete the survey. Complete the survey online: http://research.orima.com.au/dva/client/register.php?v=soc…

Applications for the Vietnam War commemorative medallion, honouring the service and sacrifice of Australians who served in the Vietnam War, will close on 26 July 2024. Vietnam veterans, their widow or other family member can apply: http://dva.gov.au/vietnam50

Over the last three months we’ve been busy transitioning our rehabilitation clients across to a new program model. That transition is now complete. Read more here: https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/rehabilitation-program-service-delivery-enhancements-are-complete…

Have your say on a new Ex-Service Organisation (ESO) Peak Body that meets the needs of you, your family, ESOs and other organisations providing advocacy support to veterans and families. Complete the survey here: https://nousgroupau.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1AfcJSDMoQkHP4W…

Last year, a Commemorative Medallion was produced for Australian veterans of the Vietnam War, their widow or other family member acknowledging the 50th anniversary of the end of Australia's involvement in the Vietnam War. Applications close 26 July 2024: http://dva.gov.au/vietnam50

Veterans’ Health Week 2024 is being held 13-20 October and is themed Keep Connected. Applications are now open for prospective event organisers to apply for up to $1000 in one-off funding to support their event. Read more: http://dva.gov.au/vhw

A lot of different people including veterans and families can be targeted by scammers. Read this latest news article, written to help you spot and then stop investment scams: https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/happy-2024-2025-financial-year…

In line with annual indexation of the income and assets thresholds, some income support pension payments are being increased from today. More: https://dva.gov.au/get-support/financial-support/payment-rates/summary-pension-rates-limits-and-allowances…
DVA veteran card holders can now reach for their phones or other smart devices to access their gold and white, digital veteran cards in their myGov wallet.
The Client Insights Survey (formerly Client Satisfaction Survey) is open! Have your say and complete the survey online today! http://research.orima.com.au/dva/client/register.php?v=soc…

Congratulations to this years’ 37 Long Tan Bursary recipients who will each receive up to $12,000 to help with tertiary study expenses. Applications for the 2025 Long Tan Bursary open soon http://dva.gov.au/about-us/overview/consultations-and-grants/grants-and-bursaries/long-tan-bursary…

Apply for the Veterans’ Acute Housing Program by 13 September for a share in $30m in grant funding to build crisis & transitional housing & provide specialist services for veterans & families experiencing or at risk of homelessness. Click to apply: http://spr.ly/6019gKxj1

MyService will be unavailable from 11:00pm AEDT Friday 20 June to 1:00pm AEDT Sunday 23 June 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice

Some Veteran Card holders with chronic health conditions may be eligible for the Coordinated Veterans’ Care Program. This program supports you to live a healthier life through effective, ongoing management of your condition. For more info: http://dva.gov.au/CVCforveterans
Today marks 25 years since the @AusFedPolice arrival in East Timor, now Timor-Leste, as part of the @UN Assistance Mission in East Timor (UNAMET). We honour all those who served.

Each year, the Australian Government commits $3.5 million to the Saluting Their Service Grants Program to help preserve our nation’s wartime heritage. Applications for the last round of this financial year are now open. Apply at GrantConnect: http://grants.gov.au

Today marks the 55th anniversary of the Battle of Binh Ba of the Vietnam War. As we reflect on the sacrifices made by those who served and their families, we also remember all who have been impacted by war and conflict. To learn more, visit https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/wars-and-missions/vietnam-war-1962-1975/events/combat/battle-binh-ba-1969…

Today we commemorate the 80th Anniversary of the D-Day landings. On 6 June, we remember the sacrifices, dedication, and resilience of all who served, their families, and all affected by the Second World War. Lest We Forget.

Scams can happen to a lot of different people, including veterans and families. Read this latest news article, written to help you spot and then stop scams: https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/huge-prize-pool-give-away-too-good-be-true…
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people please be advised that this post contains the names and images of deceased persons.

This #NRW2024, we spotlight Gunditjmara man Reginald ‘Reg‘ Saunders MBE. Born in 1920, he served with distinction in the Second World War and the Korean War. We honour all First Nations service men and women who have served in the Australian Defence Force.

Thank you to the trailblazing women veterans who attended our Women Veterans’ Policy Forum in Canberra recently. Outcomes will be detailed in an upcoming report and published the DVA website. For more info or to access past reports visit https://dva.gov.au/about/overview/consultations-and-grants/consultation-women-veterans…
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people please be advised that this post contains the names and images of deceased persons.

#NRW2024 is a time to reflect on those who have left their indelible mark, such as Darug woman Marion Leane Smith, the only Aboriginal woman recorded to have served in the First World War. We remember her efforts and those of all First Nations people who have served in the ADF.

#NRW2024 is an opportunity to reflect on how we can all stay connected, understand our histories, cultures and achievements, & move forward together to achieve better outcomes in genuine, respectful partnership with First Nations people. We're all stronger when we work together.

Thank you to everyone who shared their feedback in our recent MyService Experience Survey. To discover what you can do in MyService visit: https://dva.gov.au/myservice#find-out-what-you-can-do-in-myservice…

Happy #NationalVolunteerWeek!

Volunteers are awesome. They contribute their time and knowledge for the sole benefit of others. 

To all volunteers, especially those who are #ADFVeterans, we say thank you!

#NVW2024

The Australian Government has announced the Federal Budget for 2024-25, including an additional $477 million to increase support for veterans and families and simplify veteran compensation legislation. Read more: https://dva.gov.au/budget-2024-25
Whether you use or don’t use MyService, we want to hear from you! Complete our MyService experience survey before it closes on Thursday https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_b3AYQEPmPTUjp4O…

Check out our latest news article about direct marketing, a popular tactic used by third party organisations and providers to target veterans: https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/knock-knock-are-third-party-organisations-trying-get-your-attention…

MyService will be unavailable from 10:00pm AEST Saturday 11 May to 6:00am AEST Sunday 12 May 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice

‘Let the Light Shine’ is a new documentary exploring tales of courage and conflict through the enduring beauty of stained glass. More info here: https://shrine.org.au/screening-let-light-shine…

The filmmakers successfully applied to our Saluting Their Service Grants Program: https://dva.gov.au/about/overview/consultations-and-grants/grants-and-bursaries/saluting-their-service-sts-commemorative-grants-program…

Today, in 1945, Victory in Europe Day was proclaimed by the Allies, recognising the unconditional surrender of Germany in the Second World War. We remember the service and sacrifice of our countrymen and women in the pursuit of the Allied victory. Lest we forget.

If you’re a veteran, you can access many of our health programs through your GP, such as a Veterans’ Health Check, Coordinated Veterans’ Care, medication management reviews and more. Next time you visit your GP, let them know you’re an #ADFVeteran and ask how they can help!
We want to hear from members of the veteran community who don’t use MyService, to help us understand why, so we can make it more accessible. Have your say today: http://spr.ly/6016j57su

The Anzac Day Schools’ Awards foster gratitude, respect, and an understanding of our military personnel. This year’s focus is local veterans, encouraging students to find innovative ways to connect with those who have served in their community. More info: https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/education/anzac-day-schools-awards…

#ICYMI check out Vetaffairs Vol. 40 for all the latest veterans’ news! Available online, in PDF, MP3 audio or good old-fashioned hard copy! Download your copy today: https://dva.gov.au/news/vetaffairs/vetaffairs-vol-40-no1-april-2024…

Thank you for having your say and helping to shape the future of veterans’ legislation. The Australian Government will consider all of your feedback before it introduces the VETS Bill into the Parliament. All of the info regarding the proposed changes will remain on our website.

We will soon be running our annual Client Benefits Client Satisfaction Survey, with the help of independent research organisation, ORIMA Research. More information is on our website https://dva.gov.au/about/overview/consultations-and-grants/client-benefits-client-satisfaction-survey…

MyService will be unavailable from midnight to 04:00am AEST Sunday 28 April 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice
The Spirit of Anzac was on display across the country and around the world yesterday as many gathered to pay their respects to those who have served our nation on #AnzacDay.

The newly refurbished Surrender Point Memorial is now open to the public.

The iconic memorial marks the site of surrender by the Japanese Army to Australian forces in one of the ceremonies that concluded the war in the Pacific in the Second World War.

They shall grow not old,
as we that are left grow old;
Age shall not weary them,
nor the years condemn.
At the going down of the sun
and in the morning
We will remember them.
#LestWeForget

Today is Kapyong Day, marking the anniversary of the Battle of Kapyong in the Korean War. Our thoughts are with all Australians who served in the Korean War and their families. Their efforts and sacrifices shall always be honoured and remembered. Lest we forget.

The Anzac Day Schools' Awards help students deepen their understanding of Australia's wartime history. 2024's theme encourages students to get to know veterans in their local area & honour their service & sacrifice. Entries close 5pm, 31 May 2024 (AEST). https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/education/anzac-day-schools-awards…

Through the Department of Veterans’ Affairs, we assist in the restoration and preservation of existing overseas memorials. This funding ensures that the service by Australian men and women is remembered into the future. To find out more, visit https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/preserving-our-anzac-legacy-abroad-future-generations…

Annually, we distribute a commemorative pack to schools, ex-service organisations, and other associations for Anzac Day. These resources cover elements of military service and daily life during and outside wars and conflicts. To find out more, visit: https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/commemoration/anzac-day-package…

As #AnzacDay approaches, it's vital its traditions and stories live on. Our Anzac Day Kitbag can help younger generations gain an understanding and appreciation of the significance of Anzac Day. These school holidays, explore the Anzac Day Kitbag – https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/resources/anzac-day-kitbag…

Missed the VETS Bill webinars? You can watch a recording on the DVA website. We encourage all members of the veteran community to watch the webinar recording to learn more about how the proposed changes will impact you. Visit https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-get-involved-and-submit-your-feedback…

Join us next week on April 25, Anzac Day, to remember them. The @ABC will have comprehensive coverage of #AnzacDay national and international dawn services so you can commemorate, no matter where you are. For more info visit:

We need your help to let us know what works, what doesn’t work and what you want to see in MyService. Have your say and complete our MyService experience survey today https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_b3AYQEPmPTUjp4O…

Each year, we distribute commemorative packs to ensure the service and sacrifice of our military personnel lives on in the hearts of all Australians. The 2024 pack includes three unique commemorative posters. Find out more by visiting our Anzac portal – https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/commemoration/anzac-day-package…
Find out more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. We are hosting webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://dva.gov.au/VETS_Bill_feedback…

How we honour and remember the service and sacrifice of our military personnel is a deeply personal decision. If you’re planning to commemorate Anzac Day, in public or private, and are unsure where to start, we've resources to help guide you. Visit: https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/commemoration/event-planning…

Veteran Gold or White Card holders with eligibility under the Veterans' Entitlements Act 1986 (VEA) may have access to the Booked Car with Driver service, where DVA arranges taxi or hire car travel for clients to attend approved treatment with no out of pocket expenses.

Visit the DVA website to learn more: http://spr.ly/6010wqy7A
 Accessibility: All content in the infographic is available in an accessible format on DVA’s website.
If you missed DVA’s inaugural online Community Consultations Town Hall event, the recording is now available! Click to watch webinar: http://spr.ly/6018wlOEq

The Veterans’ Health Check can help you manage and take charge of your own health, take action to stay well, address health concerns early and develop a relationship with your GP. For more information on the Veterans’ Health Check, visit http://dva.gov.au/veteranhealthcheck…

Find out more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. We are hosting three webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://dva.gov.au/VETS_Bill_feedback…
Find out more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. We are hosting webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://dva.gov.au/VETS_Bill_feedback…

Veterans will retain their Totally and Permanently Incapacitated (TPI) benefits under the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. Benefits arising from claims, including TPI, lodged prior to 1 July 2026 would be grandparented. More here: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-do-changes-impact-you…

Service providers and other third-party organisations play an important role in offering programs and services for veterans and families. Most do the right thing, but some don’t, read more here: http://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/can-you-recognise-suspicious-provider-behaviour…

Applications for VetPaths 2024 close tomorrow! Have your questions answered –listen to senior APS leaders, a past VetPaths participant and recruitment specialists discuss everything VetPaths. Access the VetPaths Live Event here: https://dva.gov.au/about/careers/continuing-serve-vetpaths-aps-veteran-employment-pathway…

We provide veterans with profound hearing loss specialised smoke alarm packages that include a high quality smoke alarm, vibration pad, and flashing light. For more details and to see if you are eligible, visit: https://dva.gov.au/get-support/providers/rehabilitation-appliances-program-rap/rap-national-guidelines/assistive-listening-devices-alds-tinnitus-devices-and-hearing-devices…

Find out more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. We are hosting three webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://dva.gov.au/VETS_Bill_feedback…

You will retain your current benefits under proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. Existing entitlements will be ‘grandparented’, meaning veterans and families who already receive payments and benefits won’t experience any changes. Read more: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-do-changes-impact-you…

You’re invited to attend DVA’s inaugural online Community Consultations Town Hall event on Veteran and Families Hubs. Join DVA’s Deputy Secretary, Alison McLaren and Mark Brewer, the acting Deputy President of the Repatriation Commission on April 9 from 12:30pm-14:00pm AEST.
Click to join event on April 9, 12:30pm: http://spr.ly/6012ZbjU0
Find out more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. We are hosting three webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://spr.ly/6017ZbT1c

Have you separated or transitioned from the ADF and wanting to move into a career in the APS – this is your opportunity! Submit your application to the VetPaths 2024. Applications close Thursday 4 April. Learn more here: https://dva.gov.au/about/careers/continuing-serve-vetpaths-aps-veteran-employment-pathway…

The Australian Government is inviting expressions of interest to fill future Australian War Memorial (Memorial) Council positions. Expressions of interest close at 11:59pm AEST on Sunday, 5 May 2024. Further details here: http://dvajobs.nga.net.au

Would you like to know more about the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation? We are hosting three webinars to explain how the proposed VETS Bill could impact you. Attend here: http://dva.gov.au/VETS_Bill_feedback…

Register your attendance for the VetPaths 2024 online information session! Hear first-hand experiences from past VetPaths participants, learn more about the app process, how your experience and skills translate and ask questions. To register please email VetPaths@dva.gov.au

MyService will be unavailable from 00:00 AEDST Sunday 24 March until 4:00am AEDST Sunday 24 March 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice

Our dedicated staff from the Office of Australian War Graves continue to care for the final resting places of those who have served our nation, even if it rains, hails or shines. In Cairns, our Regional Manager has been checking in on the war graves to assess potential damage.

Veterans won’t lose their Totally and Permanently Incapacitated (TPI) benefits under the proposed changes to veterans’ legislation. All claims, including TPI, lodged prior to 1 July 2026 will be grandparented. More here: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-do-changes-impact-you…

Have you transitioned from the ADF and are looking to continue your civilian career with the APS? Applications are now open to for the 2024 Veteran Employment Pathway! Applications close 4 April - submit your application: here: https://dva.gov.au/about/careers/continuing-serve-vetpaths-aps-veteran-employment-pathway…

On 20 March some veteran pension payments will increase in line with pension indexation. For more information including a summary of pension rates, limits and allowances please visit: https://dva.gov.au/get-support/financial-support/payment-rates/summary-pension-rates-limits-and-allowances…

Expressions of Interest for the Women Veterans Policy Forum are closing soon! The Forum is an opportunity to co-design future DVA policy and service delivery options, informed by your lived experience. Register here: https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bkYhKcQH5QZXpEa…

We know the current veterans’ legislation is complex and causes delays. The proposed Veterans’ Entitlements, Treatment and Support (Simplification and Harmonisation) Bill 2024 will change that. Submissions close Sunday 28 April. Learn more: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/draft-legislation-what-it-and-what-it-will-do…

Worried you’ll lose your benefits under changes to veterans’ legislation? Don’t be! Existing entitlements will be ‘Grandparented’, meaning veterans and families who already receive payments and benefits won’t experience any changes. Read more: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-do-changes-impact-you…

MyService will be unavailable from 23:00 AEDST Friday 15 March until 13:00 AEDST Sunday 17 March 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice

Congratulations to @RSLQueensland on their selection as the lead organisation to develop a Veterans’ and Families’ Hub in Ipswich. To support the development of the Hub, the Australian Government is providing RSL Queensland with a grant of $5.445 million. @mattkeogh

There’s one week left to register your interest in our 2024 Women Veterans Policy Forum! Your voice matters, and we encourage all women who have served in the ADF to get involved. Register your interest here: https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bkYhKcQH5QZXpEa…

The Minister for Veterans’ Affairs @mattkeogh today announced a $5.445 million grant for @RSLLifeCare  to establish a Veterans’ and Families’ Hub in the Hunter region.

Great news for the veteran community in the Hunter!

Learn more: http://dva.gov.au/vfhubs

More than 90 applicants will share in over $1 million of funding through the 2023-24 Saluting Their Service commemorative grants program.

For more information, or to apply for the next batch, visit: http://grants.gov.au

Expressions of Interest for our upcoming Women Veterans Policy Forum are now open! Your voice matters, and we encourage all women who have served in the ADF to get involved. Register your interest here:
https://dva.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bkYhKcQH5QZXpEa…

Registrations close 11.59pm AEDT Wednesday, 20 March. Numbers are limited.

If you have any questions about the Forum email us at  consultation@ http://dva.gov.au

From today, a new model comes into effect - improving the way providers deliver our Rehabilitation Program. You can read about the changes here: https://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/rehabilitation-program-service-delivery-enhancements-commenced…

An image you can hear

Veterans who have participated in the @healthgovau Hearing Services Program (HSP) are encouraged to provide their feedback via an online survey here: https://consultations.health.gov.au/rpgd-hearing/6f8d4950/consultation/intro/… 

The survey will take approximately  15 minutes and closes on  2 April 2024.
RSL LifeCare has been awarded a $5.445 million grant to establish a unique Veterans’ and Families’ Hub network, connecting the Hawkesbury to South Western Sydney. Learn more: http://dva.gov.au/vfhubs

The 2024-25 Saluting Their Service Commemorative Grants program is now open with $3.5 million available this year.

We encourage community groups undertaking commemorative projects or activities to apply.

Further details here: http://communitygrants.gov.au

The draft Veterans’ Entitlements, Treatment and Support (VETS) Bill 2024 will provide a simpler and easier to use system for the veteran community. We want to hear from those the VETS Bill will impact the most. Submit your feedback here: https://dva.gov.au/about/royal-commission/veterans-legislation-reform-exposure-draft-consultation/how-get-involved-and-submit-your-feedback…
You have the opportunity to shape the future of veterans’ entitlements legislation by having your say during the consultation period – 28 February to 28 April, 2024.
We encourage you to review the VETS Bill, understand what’s different and why, and provide your feedback: https://dva.gov.au/legislationreform…

The Government is simplifying veterans’ legislation so veterans & families can get the support they deserve. The draft Veterans’ Entitlements, Treatment and Support (VETS)(Simplification and Harmonisation) Bill 2024 will provide an easier to use system for the veteran community.

Today on #NationalDayForWarAnimals, we remember all of the critters who, like Cocky, looked out for their mates. Not just on the battlefield, but at home. Read about the cockatoo who lifted the spirits of First World War veterans here: https://awm.gov.au/collection/RELAWM08024…

MyService will be unavailable from midnight Saturday 24 February 2024 to 03:00am AEDST Sunday 25 February 2024 while we apply updates to the system. We appreciate your patience. For more information on MyService please visit our website: https://dva.gov.au/myservice

Earlier this week, the Government announced $5.445 million funding for RSL Victoria to establish a Veterans’ and Families’ Hub in the Surf Coast/Geelong region. Great news for the region’s 6,600 veterans and families who’ll receive the support they deserve much closer to home.

‘For Every Drop Shed in Anguish’ is more than a sculpture, it’s a place of remembrance and reflection. To watch a recording of the livestream of the Dedication Ceremony please visit the @AWMemorial website: https://awm.gov.au/about/our-work/projects/sufferings-of-war-and-service/dedication-ceremony…

Get your BEST application in before 9:00pm AEDT, 29 February 2024. Building Excellence in Support and Training (BEST) grants provide funding for ex-service organisations who offer assistance with entitlements, services and claims. Visit: http://spr.ly/6012nrEte

The Victorian Garden of Remembrance (GRM) within the Springvale Botanical Cemetery is temporarily closed to the public until the impacts of recent weather events are assessed in full and the site is deemed safe for visitors. The Springvale War Cemetery is open.

On this day 82 years ago, Japanese forces bombed Darwin, marking the first incursion on Australian soil during the Second World War. Today, we commemorate those who served and remember the sacrifices they and their families made in the defence of our nation. #LestWeForget

Today we observe National Servicemen’s Day. Over 280,000 Australians served as ‘Nashos’ in two schemes following the Second World War. Today we pause to remember the sacrifices made by all ‘Nashos’ and their families. #Lestweforget
: @AWMemorial

Asking for support isn't admitting defeat, you’re calling in fire support. 

Communication is key, and today on #WorldRadioDay we acknowledge a handy piece of kit which helps us connect to one another, no matter where we are. 

Signal us on 1800 011 046 for 24/7 support

Did you know Ex-Service Organisations offer free advocacy services to help veterans and families with DVA claims and wellbeing support.  You don’t need to pay someone to help you. Find an ESO advocate here.

Read more: http://dva.gov.au/news/latest-stories/free-advocacy-support-veterans-and-their-families…

The Anzac Day Schools’ Awards are open!  

The theme for 2024 is “Discover the stories of veterans in your local community”. 

For more, visit our Anzac Portal https://anzacportal.dva.gov.au/education/anzac-day-schools-awards…

Older veterans using mobility scooters and adaptive household appliances are urged to always follow manufacturer’s instructions when recharging their equipment following an increasing number of fires linked to the lithium-ion batteries  @ACCCProdSafety
UPDATE 29/01/2024: Our Townsville office has reopened today!

Australia has a rich and storied history, of highs and lows, of peace and conflict. None play a more solemn role in Australia's history than those who have served in the @Australian_Navy @AustralianArmy & @AusAirForce
#AusNavy #AusArmy #AusAirForce #YourADF #ADFVeterans

Pick any chapter of our nation's history and you'll find a common theme. From the cliffs of Gallipoli to the jungles of Vietnam. From the Coral Sea to the skies above Korea. From the Pacific Islands to the deserts of the Middle East. Wherever you look you'll find mateship.

Today, on Australia Day, we reflect on our nation's history and remember those who served the nation they called home. You can read stories of service from our nation’s history on our Anzac Portal here:

Our Townsville office will be closed today due to Tropical Cyclone Kirrily. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. You can still call us on 1800 VETERAN (1800 838 372) or lodge enquiries through MyService. Call  000 in an emergency.

Final call for veterans working in civilian medical, logistics corporate (female specific) roles, or as a cook/chef, to feature in a new national advertising campaign. Download the form: http://spr.ly/6016TjoJI & send it to  veteransemployment@dva.gov.au by midday 25 January.
